intro: Geonoma parvisecta, commonly known as the small-lobed pteridophyte, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds with finely divided pinnae. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its small size and intricate leaf structure make it a unique addition to botanical collections. It plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing microhabitats for small organisms.
